Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: eerq
Reviews.Content: Nice, clean and comfortable, the staff spoke english pretty well and was always very friendly and helpful. Location is good, close to Sagrada Familia, it also has a metro station within 5 minutes walking distance and plenty of small restaurants around. What i didn't liked: everyday the breakfast is the same and it's very basic. I think that for the same price you would be better off by grabbing a byte at some of the the restaurants around on your way to the metro station.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: VWCalgary
Reviews.Content: This is a very affordable hotel. Even though the room is small, it is comfortable, clean and centrally located. It is very close to the metro station, the Sagrada Familia and grocery stores. Also close by there are a few bakeries that serve good baking and the cappucinno are great too! The front desk staff are good, very patient and helpful. I strongly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here if you want to just crash in to sleep...”
Reviews.Author: travellerish
Reviews.Content: Central, clean, very small, but good to crash in for the night if you are feeling very touristy... You can check in early.. make sure u bring your toiletries...

Reviews.Title: “comfortable”
Reviews.Author: onur d
Reviews.Content: near to the metro station, and just 5 min walk away from Sagrada Familia. room was clean and bed was comfortable. just a little warning while writing a review, I was pick pocketed at Universitade metro station. Recommend to be very careful while using metro station. There is snack machine at the hotel, I guess it was at restaurant floor. If you are thirsty in the middle of night, its existence really makes you happy.

Reviews.Title: “Budget Hotel Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Rebecca M
Reviews.Content: Inexpensive and fairly basic, but great value. Excellent transport links, free wifi throughout Hotel. Not big rooms but we weren't there to stay in. Room and bathroom were spotless. However, the dowsed was the throw on the bed had a hole in it, housekeeping forgot to leave towels one evening, and we didn't try the breakfast, no tea or coffee facilities in the room. However, we would recommend this hotel as 110 Euros for 2 nights was great value.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and very Helpful & Friendly”
Reviews.Author: LyonsGate
Reviews.Content: Acta Antibes is very close to Sarada Famiia and even closer to the Monumental Metro Stop. The room was very reasonably priced. They even gave us a suite with an extra bedroom. The windows all had thick double paines which blocked out almost all street noise. The room was a little too warm but they had a very cold Winter this year. So who could blame them for wanting a little more heat? The staff went out of their way to be extra helpful and pleasant. The room was very clean and modern with lots of towels. We were there for 4 nights (March 2012) but wish we could have stayed longer.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Dimitar B
Reviews.Content: The hotel has perfect location, near Sagrada Familia, bus and metro station. Very clean and with very polite and friendly staff. I booked double room and I asked for king size bed and that was exactly what I got. Good air condition, which is important for place like Barcelona. The breakfast was wonderful as well. That is why I am going back there in the end of May, can't wait...

Reviews.Title: “5 days in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Charis80
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Acta Antibes July 2011. The location of the hotel is great near Sagrada Familia and 200 meters from the closest Metro Station. The guys in the reception were great and very helpfull when we needed some tips for our staying there. Very nice hotel and quiet. The neighborhood is really quiet and nearby are some cafe's with very nice breakfast delicacies. Really nice choise as it is cheap too.

Reviews.Title: “Good budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: kat_h34_11
Reviews.Content: The room was clean and comfortable. It was smaller than it seemed to be in the photos but not too small. The bathroom was also nice and clean. We found it easy to walk from there to Sagrada Familia and Monumental Metro station.We stayed for 3 nights and found it convenient to have breakfast in the hotel before exploring the city.Barcelona was such a fantastic city.We loved visiting all the Gaudi sites. Apart from Sagrada Familia we visited Park Guell and La Pedrera.It was really easy to get around from there.We used the metro , but also walked a lot. One night we walked back to Acta Antibes from La Rambla.The room was quiet and we had no problem with noise from other rooms.The staff were also friendly and helpful although not very impressed with my attempts at speaking Spanish!!!(not in an unfriendly way,more just not wanting to waste time trying to speak Spanish with such a beginner and preferring to communicate in their much better English--than my Spanish)It was a quiet location which suited us, and not much was open nearby late at night for dinner, although we did have dinner one night in a Tapas Bar just across the road. The owner was very friendly and patient with my Spanish.. We even had a chat.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended!”
Reviews.Author: Cathy B
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel with a friend for three nights. Even prior to our arrival the staff were extremely helpful, responding promptly to emails and recommending the best route to get to the hotel via public transport. The room itself was clean and comfortable, and large given that it's a two star hotel. Our room was at the back of the hotel so there was no street noise. The only thing I would say about it is that because the rooms have wooden floors you could hear quite a bit of noise from the rooms above and beside us. The location was excellent - it is a 2 minute walk to the nearest Metro station, and a 5 minute walk to Sagrada Familia which is a must-see for anyone staying in Barcelona. We also walked into the city centre one of the days which only took 20 minutes. I would highly recommend this hotel for anyone going to visit Barcelona. It's an excellent base from which to explore this beautiful city. It certainly feels like more than a 2 star, and is excellent value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, central and very helpful staff!”
Reviews.Author: ViviLau
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately for me, my holiday didn't go off too well. Some Barca undesirables decided to lighten my load by helping themselves to my travel wallet. Containing my passport and cash. My feet had only touched Spanish soil for an hour, if that, when it happened. Needless to say, I was shocked and not looking forward to the rest of my holiday. My two friends and I arrived at Acta Antibes and the staff were friendly and very helpful. Upon hearing of my incident, they found out all the necessary information I needed to report the crime and get my Emergency Travel Document so I could get home at the end of my holiday. I am terribly fussy when it comes to hotels, but I have to say, it was quiet and the rooms here were very clean - even by my standards. Thankfully, the beds were very comfortable so I managed to get a good nights sleep. The location is perfect for shopping and the main sights and attractions of Barcelona. It literally is 10minutes walk from the beautiful Gaudi Cathedral. (Sagrada Familia). There is also a lovely little bakery nearby where you can get a tasty pastry and a nice cup of tea for your breakfast. I don't normally write reviews, but I felt I needed to write something and thank Acta Antibes for being so helpful. With the help of my friends and the lovely hotel staff, my holiday wasn't a total disaster. Thank you, staff of Acta Antibes. Room 603!

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable choice”
Reviews.Author: Joaquin5
Reviews.Content: Hotel Acta Antibes is a decent, reasonably-priced hotel in the eastern part of the Eixample of Barcelona. It is one block north of the Gran Via and a few minutes walk to Metro Monumental. Breakfast is optional (a little pricey at 8.70 euros). As another reviewer mentioned, it is not spectacular, but it is clean and comfortable enough, staff are helpful with enough English spoken. Wifi is free, but can be patchy depending on the room you are in. You also need to get separate password for each electronic device you are using. All in all, a reasonable choice.

Reviews.Title: “Very good”
Reviews.Author: julyaMoscow
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very good solution for low price. Breakfast in this hotel is not very variety but not so bad. We arrived to BCN for walking and we're not spend much time in room. View from our window was brick wall))) But it's so cold in room in the night (dec - jan). Stuff are very friendly. La Sagrada Familia - 10-15 minutes. Passeig de Gràcia - about 20 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Simple, clean, central”
Reviews.Author: benFlys
Reviews.Content: While nothing spectacular, this place offers a reasonably priced central location to explore the city. I found it to be clean, comfortable and with helpful staff. I would stay here again without hesitation if I needed a reasonably priced

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for the first visit”
Reviews.Author: panjegoli
Reviews.Content: This hotel is centrally located and is just 5 min walk from Monumental metro station. The staff are friendly.The room is clean enough but the bed was not that comfortable. We got two single beds placed side by side to make a couple bed. They moved quite often and we had to be careful not to fall down the groove!!! The breakfast is not included and it is costs Eur. The WiFi is available. We did not have enough shampoo in the room and when I called for it, they said I should go downstairs to pick it up which I did not do since I was not in the mood to get dressed!!! No tea or coffee making facility or a fridge.

Reviews.Title: “Good decent hotel in a nice location if you can get it cheap.”
Reviews.Author: travellingdudes
Reviews.Content: Centrally located, about 10 mins walk from any/all touristy places. Clean. Wireless internet is super fast. TV has enough channels. If you can get it for under 45 euro (winter 2011) then it is a great deal.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: ILove2Travel69
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfect for visiting a great town. The room was: "nothing more nothing less". Good bed. Quiet. Clean. But not very cosy. But who needs that when your out all day visiting BCN. It's near the Metro station Monumental. Just 2 min. walk. Or the bus at Gran Via. Wifi was weak at the room but worked perfectly in the lobby. Staff was very friendly and helpfull. We had room 510 which was at the rear off the building. You could open your window for fresh air at night. And still it was quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel for first visit”
Reviews.Author: audzman
Reviews.Content: Stayed here between 27/29 october 2011. The hotel was really handy for Estacio Nord bus staion and also Monumental metro stop, which was aboon to first time visitors to this attractions filled city. The Hotel staff at check in were friendly , quick , helpful and efficient. Our room , No.408 was at the rear of the hotel overlooking a small enclosed court yard and neighbouring apartments. No Tea or coffee making facilities or iron. Noise could be heard from adjoining rooms, espacially in the bathroom Otherwisw it was quiet and although overlooked not intrusive , also no traffic noise. Breakfast was plentiful although the choice could have been more extensive. A good hotel to choose for my first visit but would look further afield as my confidence in navigating the city is better now.

Reviews.Title: “average to good..”
Reviews.Author: liesenrut
Reviews.Content: stayed 4 nights. would not have stayed there if we had done better investigation on the location... walking distance from the sagrada familia, but far from the rest of the 'attractions'. clean but small rooms. breakfast no worth taking it there.

Reviews.Title: “affordable comfort”
Reviews.Author: trvlgrly
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay here. The room was quiet, temperature & mattresses comfortable. The staff, polite, professional, and gave great dining recommendations. Wi-fi too weak to work on our droid phones in our end room, but we didn't mind using soft seating on second floor adjacent to breakfast room to access the web when necessary.

Reviews.Title: “Acta Antibes - Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: AllieH
Reviews.Content: I am just home from 4 nights at the Acta Antibes and for the first time I have felt the need to leave a review. Okay so this is a simple 3 star hotel - go into knowing this and you will love it. The room is spacious enough, we had two twin beds and there was enough room to move around them and the bathroom was simple anf effective - the shower is at the side of the bath instead of the end so the curtain sticks to you a bit! The free wifi is really handy, full signal and fast enough. You get a code for each device you need when you check in - my sim stopped working a day into my trip so having wifi made this so much easier. This hotel is so close the bus station that the buses come in to from Girona - an easy walk even carrying bags. The local metro station is Monumental and it is a very easy walk away. The small bar across the road - Yuste has to be tried, we ate Tapas in lots of places and found the couple of things we tried as a snack here whilst waiting for a friend to be some of the best we tried. We tried the breakfast one day and it is simple, rolls and croissants and cheese and ham plus the usual fruit and yoghurt. It was just over 8 Euros each and I would say that it was worth it although there are plenty of local places that looked lovely. We had the most fantastic time in Barcelona, covered a lot of ground and felt we got to know it quite well. Highlights - the open top bus tour, I love these to get a feel for a city, well we enjoyed this but it went to so many places we weren't interested in it isn't as good as those in other sities, if you are undecided I would advise you to give it a miss. The old town is fantastic, hard to get bearings but don't worry, just wander! The Rambas - hmmm good to see but not worth staying on for long - get into the small streets. As for Tapas I can't recommend highly enough the Lonja de Tapas - fantastic, and we treid a few places and chose to go back there for our last night. We also tried the highly recomended Ciudad Condal and I am afraid to say that we didn't really rate it. Not as much as Lonja www.lonjadetapas.com. Other highlight is cycling. I haven't been on a bike in over 20 years and was worried about keeping up with my 13 year old BMX mad son! Okay so my legs got tired and it was a bit scary at first but I would really suggest you give it a try. We didn't want to use the orange amsterdam bike place as they didn't have gears so we went for BornBike. They were so helpful and friendly I wouldn't hesitate to suggest you go to them. Those are my highlights, if you are going soon, get excited it is an incredible city!

Reviews.Title: “We will return”
Reviews.Author: CarolineBath
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four nights as a group of 19. Very clean. Bed comfortable. The breakfast was continental only so we went out for our cooked breakfast to Restaurant Nogal - just around the corner to the right. Only 5 euros for a taxi from Placa de Catalunya to the hotel and 35 euros from the airport to the hotel. The reception staff were very helpful - they booked restaurants, taxis and also sorted out our football tickets which hadn't arrived on time.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and reasonably priced”
Reviews.Author: Kinnerfingerabropper
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is in Eixample, somewhat in the middle of Sagrada Familia and Plaça de Catalunya. The staff is very friendly and helpful, the room is clean and big enough to feel comfy and even comes with a safe. The bathroom's got a bath tub and a bidet! TV has several channels in English, Italian, French,German and of course Spanish. Breakfast is 8.70 Euros but they tell you when checking in. You'll find a small supermarket around the corner and the staff knows a few good restaurants, too. If you don't expect it to be the Hilton, you won't be disappointed! Definitely feels like more than 2 Stars.

Reviews.Title: “We would go back.”
Reviews.Author: Richard186394
Reviews.Content: We stayed here over the Merce Festival in late September.Small room but comfortable and clean,fresh towels dailey,friendly and helpful staff and a good selection at the buffet breakfast.about 15 minutes walk to the center.

Reviews.Title: “Very good but with exceptions”
Reviews.Author: syberian
Reviews.Content: I stayed here from 17/9 to 22/9 and I would have been quite satisfied in every respect but with two exceptions. Firstly, in my room (407) the bottom surface of the bath was very slippery causing me to slip and fall while having a shower. I fell out of the bath and struck my head on the stone sink. I was extremely fortunate to only receive a glancing blow to my head with a slight wound. Another 2 cm and my skull could have been fractured. I submitted a complaint form to the management and suggested that a proper non-slip surface and a support rail be provided. Secondly, for the last night of my stay the price of the room increased from €69.75 to €130.30. I can only attribute this to the fact that this was due to the Feria de Merce in the city which commenced that day. I call this blatant profiteering and is quite unjustifiable.

Reviews.Title: “the best 2* in barca”
Reviews.Author: bennyjungle
Reviews.Content: what a great hotel! the location is great - not too busy and only 2 stops into center on metro. the room was good, with a nice flat screen tv and many channels (although only bbc news in english - small tip most tv shows you can select subtitles from remote in many languages) we went for the breakfast 1 day just to see what its like - at 8euros each its quite expensive! the food was ok lots to choose from ham cheese croissants cereals fruit salad coffee esspresso various teas!! so if you are a big big breakfast eater then its ok but we only have 1crossant + coffe so it wasnt worth our while! we had our room cleaned every day which is very impressive for such a large hotel (71 rooms) rooms were very very clean although 1 downside is that the cleaners are very loud like other people here have said, its like they want to wake everyone up to get in the rooms quicker? so if you are someone who likes to lie in, then you cant really unless you are a real heavy sleeper! they knock about from 8am - 11am something to be weary of! also other people are right you can here the rooms next to you, loo flushing etc footsteps but this is to be expected with he building and construction of the hotel and the noise is not that loud. We also had a safe too! i dont think it was specified in my booking that we had one, you can probably fit a 13" laptop in there, dont think it will fit ones any bigger. But the best thing about the hotel is the helpfulness of staff!!! This is the most helpful hotel ive ever been to- the staff helped us in every way possible from finding a local gym, giving us maps, directions, local restaurants etc they were able to assist with every query! really friendly and polite! if im in barca again I will definitely be staying here. Oh and the air con system is highly advanced and works perfectly! Our room was on the 3rd floor.

Reviews.Title: “Deserves all the good reviews”
Reviews.Author: RachSydney2010
Reviews.Content: This hotel definitely deserves better than their 2 star rating! Hotel exterior is very modern and reception staff was always friendly and helpful. I had a single room, which had a single bed and it was very spacious. The bed was very comfortable and the ensuite bathroom was spotlessly clean. I had a view of a concrete wall out of my window but that didn't bother me the slightest. There is a big supermarket practically right outside the hotel. The only slight negative thing is the location. It's about a 10 minute walk to Sagrada Familia and about a 20 minute walk to Las Ramblas. But given the price and the value for money factor I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: GabrieleSpagnoli
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel, higher than a 2 star. The hotel is quite new inside, has tv with international channels, air conditioned, hair dryer, new bathroom with a giant shower!New interiors!near to Sagrada Familia.!! Remember to take the coupon in the all to have some special discount (10%) in main attractions of Barcelona! Enjoy

Reviews.Title: “Nice budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bebadosamba
Reviews.Content: This is a pretty affordable option in Barcelona. Nice and very clean rooms, not noisy place, near Sagrada Familia and subway station Monumental. Those looking for the busiest part of the city shoud know that location is not exactly perfect for that. Staff varies from pretty friendly to straightforward but always efficient.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: Freeman_Family
Reviews.Content: This is a great little hotel which offers good value for money and which I would have no trouble in recommending. The Receptionist staff were friendly, welcoming and provided a nice personal touch. On booking, I had requested a double room and one room with two single beds. Our boys were delighted when they discovered their room was in fact two rooms in one. This isn't a luxury hotel but the rooms were immaculately clean, basic but comfortable and functional and IMO, professionally run. Help and assistance was clearly there if you needed it, otherwise low profile. Breakfast was simple but sufficient in a pleasant-enough bright room. Location for our purposes was absolutely fine.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, good location”
Reviews.Author: Joe_Munster
Reviews.Content: We liked this hotel. The biggest plus for families is that the Quads and Triples actually had 2 seperate bedrooms. It was in the quiet Eixample neighboorhood. Easy to get to restaurants, bakeries, etc. 1/4 mile to Sagrada Family about 1/2 mile from La Rambla and Barri Gothic. 2 blocks from Metro stop. Great bakery a block away on corner. Feed a family of 4 under 10 Euro. PLUSES: Clean Hotel Good location Friendly staff that spoke English Close to restaurants, attractions and metro. Good room size. Responsive if you have an issue. MINUS: Breakfast is not included in room rate. Cost $8.7 Euro. They are very clear to tell you this up front though. Other options are close to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for solo/budget traveler”
Reviews.Author: Kaydub08
Reviews.Content: I booked a single for one night and it was definitely that, but not uncomfortably small or poorly designed. Single bed (a bit hard, as most EU beds are in my opinion), small desk, bench/suitcase area and cupboard for clothes. Bath is small but serviceable. Flatscreen TV on the wall. Location is excellent: 10 minutes to La Sagrada de Famillia and a bit more to the main squares with all the tourist attractions. Staff were very helpful with directions and held my bags in a secure location until my room was ready (I arrived early in the morning). I believe they offer cold breakfast for an additional 8 or 9 euros but I opted out. Only criticism is that there are hardwood/vinyl floors everywhere including the hallways, so you hear every footsteop others make. Do stay here, but bring your earplugs.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value For Money”
Reviews.Author: xXsarah_angelXx
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 7 nights in July and true to the reviews we had read we found the hotel to be clean, well positioned and good value for money. The rooms were cleaned every day with amenities replenished if needed. A safe was provided in the room. We choose not to eat breakfast in the hotel through personal choice, however there is a super market next door that is very reasonably priced and also a very nice cake / pastry shop 5 minutes to the right of the hotel :) The Hotel was a 10 minute walk from the bus station and also only 10 minutes from the Sagrada Familia. We choose not to use the metro (again through personal choice only) but even la Rambla was only a 20 minute walk away. Overall we would recommend this hotel for anyone staying in Barcelona. Directions from Estacio Nord - Come out of the bus station and walk up either Carrer de Sardenya or Carrer de Sicilia Keep walking until you cross a very large, 3 lane road (Gran Via) Look for Popular Bank on the corner of the road and if you stand at this bank looking up you should see the hotel at the top of the street

Reviews.Title: “Just a good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Frebel
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel located at aprox. 5-10 minutes from metrostop Monumental. The other way it is about a 15 minute walk to the Sagrada Familia. Hotel is not too hard to find and service is good and friendly. Little unlucky with a room at the back of the hotel on a low floor but the room itself is more than decent. No minbar or fridge but a good bed, nice closet and good bathroom with a small bath. Good value for price since the hotel isn't too expensice. Breakfast is not included (costs about €8,- a person so did not try it either) but a good substitute is a small local bakery one block away (on the way to metro) which has delicious croissants!

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money!”
Reviews.Author: bazik_81
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel in July 2011 on our way back from Costa Brava to home. We booked the room in January 2011 so it was only 58euro (dbl). The hotel is very close to BarcelonaNord where we arrived by bus from CostaBrava. It took us 3min to get to the hotel by taxi from BarcelonaNord and we paid 5 euro. Sagrada Familia is only 10min walk from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “nice place,nice location”
Reviews.Author: kotzeto
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a night at the hotel on our way to the Canaries.The hotel is clean and well maintained and the staff are very polite and helpful.It is close to LA SAGRADA and since our flight was late in the evening we were able to leave our luggage for free in a room next to the reception.

Reviews.Title: “good value for money, good service, highly recommended.”
Reviews.Author: assaph
Reviews.Content: we (couple age 55) stayed at acta antibes for 2 nights on june 2011. The location is good (in a residential area within walking distance from La Segrada Familia and 2 blocks from Monomental subway station), the room was large,clean and quite, and the staff was very helpfull. We also had breakfast which was rich and tastey.Will be back for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, Basic, good value”
Reviews.Author: z-way
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for Easter 2011, it is a basic, clean hotel, just slightly (but not too much) out of the way to make it good value. Reception staff is very friendly, rooms are basic but clean. The neighbourhood is quite nice, situated between the sagrada familia and the rablas so central in a way but it also means both are a bit of a hike. Free wifi is a plus

Reviews.Title: “Clean and simple”
Reviews.Author: Incognito777
Reviews.Content: Great value for 55 euros. Very simple, clean, new hotel. Friendly staff. Close to metro. Nice and safe area. Wifi spotty in some rooms (I had 2 rooms).

Reviews.Title: “Very mediocre hotel, with endemic European room problems”
Reviews.Author: supernova87a
Reviews.Content: For the life of me, I cannot understand why so many bad hotels are able to survive in Europe. Since they survive though, I feel the need to warn people, having seen the puzzlingly positive reviews here. The bottom line is that this is no place special -- I would certainly look at all options before jumping to book here based on others' seemingly positive reviews. I paid 70 Euros / night for a single (two bed) room staying here in May, and my experience was absolutely underwhelming. While the people working at this hotel are friendly and helpful, the physical hotel has the feel of a Motel 6, without the consistency. I'm not a picky traveler. But on checking in to the Acta Antibes, I had to try 3 rooms before finding one that was acceptable. The first room's bathroom smelled so strongly of chlorine, it made me gag. The second room's shower was dripping water from the floor above, through the ceiling tiles, and the third room I finally gave up and accepted, despite the wifi signal being nonexistent. At that point, every room had had a problem, and I didn't want to ask for more trouble. The staff were apologetic, and helped me each time, but it doesn't fix this property's generally poor state (at least by US standards). The hallways are dark and uninviting. The biggest problem is the bathrooms -- poorly venilated by a tenement-style dark air shaft, through which you can hear your neighbors talking and using their bathrooms. In terms of location, it was convenient enough to the metro, but other than that, there is absolutely nothing remarkable about his hotel that would make me want to stay again, and I would carefully look at other better rated places if I were you.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: JasnaB
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, very clean and pretty much new. Location is good, even though when you spend all day sightseeing you'll probably be too exhausted to walk from the center back to hotel. The only 'bad' thing about the hotel is that breakfast is way too expensive! It's cheaper to eat in a diner just across the street from the hotel. All in all, I would definitely recommend this place to anyone visiting for more than 3 days.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: coquinetto
Reviews.Content: The front desks were helpful and friendly. The location is OK. The surrounding was calm, except there's a little bit noisy came from the bathroom. I stayed there for 2 nights. If you are looking for value for money, i recommend you stay at Acta Antibes. I recommended this hotel to my friends that will visit Barcelona in May 2011.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, affordable rooms. Perfect for an overnight stay”
Reviews.Author: MaroKat
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival, reception staff were friendly and helpful. The room was clean, roomy and the bed comfortable. Even though the hotel is located on a main road, the rooms were quiet. Parking is conveniently located onsite and the city centre easily accessible if you don't mind walking. Otherwise the metro is around the corner. Even though there is no bar onsite, there are many restaurants and bars right outside your door. This hotel was perfect for an overnight stay in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, excellent staff, maximum value for money”
Reviews.Author: Selmakie
Reviews.Content: The hotel stuff is service-oriented and responses promptly to any request.They are eager to make theirs guests feel comfortable. My girlfriend and I stayed there 3 nights on in November 2010 and felt like a majestic couple. Although the rooms are somewhat basic, they are 5 star class in cleanness. The staff gave us so much information that it was like a personal tourism information office. On our last day they kept our luggage in a back room, labeled and locked. Which no extra charge. The location is 10 min walk from La Segrada Familia and 5 euro taxi-trip away from La-Rambla. We also went on foot to Gracia quarter which is just across Diagonal, northwards. In terms of value for money, it is, by far, the best hotel I have ever stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “A great base in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Annetteeee
Reviews.Content: We arrived in the evening so decided to take a taxi to the hotel. Lucky I memorised google streetmap, as the taxi driver had no idea where it was. The taxi cost around €25. The staff on duty when checking in were polite. Nothing exceptional. Cant complain. The room itself was small but clean. We had a window with a view of a fire escape and someones washing line. There was hardly any natural light. But we were happy with what we got, because we didnt go to Barcelona to stay in the hotel. Because we arrived late on a Sunday evening, we were looking for something nearby to eat. As everyone has said, there are lots of bars and cafes nearby. We chose one by Monumental station, which is less than a 5 minute walk away. I'm quite a light sleeper, but really, you can hear everything going on in the corridor and the rooms next to you. One morning, I heard the guy in the room next to me, doing his business in the bathroom from our bathroom. (bathroom has a half tub, so dont expect to have a relaxing soak after a day out.) Nights 2 and 3 were fine though, as I tired myself out from walking so much. We decided not to pay €7-8 for breakfast, and went to one of the cafes to get a hot brekkie. There is a bakery on the way to Monumental station, that sells scrummy croissants. I got one on another occasion, with a tea - around €2. Barcelona is not the place to watch 'real' Flamenco, apparently. But it was my first time to Spain and I wanted to see some Flamenco. Having done my research online, I opted for Tablao Cordobes which is on Ramblas (Was fantastic, btw). I was happy to find that you can buy your ticket at the front desk. I kept meaning to ask the name of the guy at the front desk who helped us with that, but totally forgot. He was EXTREMELY helpful. Being a massive football fan, I was asking him about the Camp Nou tour (With all the Gaudi about, I'm sorry but Camp Nou was my FAVOURITE POI). He printed out all this info for us from the website. I knew everything he told me, as I had checked the website via the free wifi (which I think every hotel should have), but he was very thorough. The hotel is walking distance to everything. As everyone has said, it's right by Sagrada Familia and its 9 blocks away from Passieg de Gracia. On our first day, we queued for around 2 hours to get into Sagrada Familia. Mind you, we got there late, so make sure to go early! We took the elevator up to the top of the tower, then took the scary walk down. I finally knew the meaning of legs feeling like jelly. After, we ate lunch, had a couple of beers to calm us down, then went back to the hotel to freshen up. We then walked to Passieg de Gracia (which I mentioned is 9 blocks away from the hotel). It was a very nice walk. It was pretty quiet, as it was around siesta. After visiting Casa Batllo, walking to Las Ramblas, exploring Mercat St Josep La Boqueria, then walking to the pier, I was absolutely exhausted. I dont regret it, but definitely would not recommend it at all. Point is, Acta Antibes is away from the raucous of the tourist spots (ramblas), but near enough to walk, sort of. It's clean and safe and right by the metro station with lots of bars and cafes nearby. Staff were lovely and they have a luggage hold too. I enjoyed Barcelona and will definitely stay at this hotel when I return.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Danlaur
Reviews.Content: Just back form Acta Antibes THIS MORNING ! Just to reitterate the other reviews on here... This Hotel is spotlessly clean, room was small but nice and clean - and has 2 double windows to keep out noisy traffic. ( we had asked to be on front as rear view was wall next door ! so staff kindly relocated us) Also could do with a few more TV channels for a late night nightcap ! Has very polite and helpful reception staff... who couldn't do enough for us and speak quite good English. One thing to be wary of.... the mini bath in our room was very slippy after a shower and my wife slipped badly. Staff were right onto it, and even purchased a bath mat !.. but point is they should be provided along with possible handrail. Hotel is only 2 blocks / five minutes walk from Monumental metro, so ideally placed to get to all the sights. Sagrada familia within 15 mins walking distance. Breakfast was good - but could do with more varity - such as a bit of Full English ! LOL IF we returned to Barcelona, would use hotel again - but now put off after the numerous reports of PICKPOCKETS ( & sadly from personal experience) :-(( Parc Guell was a lovely place to visit, also Sitges was well worth the 6 euro + 30 mins train trip - we may return there ! Can Paxiano and YUMS also cheap very friendly places for a beer or 3 !

Reviews.Title: “Very good value”
Reviews.Author: TerryEmu
Reviews.Content: The reception staff were very helpful and for the price paid was happy with this Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Good value, good service, good location but tiny tiny bathroom”
Reviews.Author: collymarps
Reviews.Content: Hotel is five minutes from Monument metro station so ideally placed to get to all the sights, sagrada familia, casa batllo and other Gaudi goodies are within walking distance too. Hotel is spotlessly clean, has polite helpful reception staff and great high speed free wifi in rooms. Breakfast is plentiful but could do with more varity as there are lots of pastry / bread type items but no fresh fruit. our room was small but nice and spotlessly clean, but the bathroom is soooo small and you need to be a contortionist in the shower cubicle to avoid leaning on the temperature gauge and scalding or freezing yourself!!! also there are no tea/coffee making facilities in the room and no fridge, these would have been handy as eating out is expensive and it would be good to be able to keep your own food in the room. all in all a good value, no frills base for exploring the sights.

Reviews.Title: “mediocre-depends on what you are looking for”
Reviews.Author: joe321_2
Reviews.Content: While I wasn't expecting luxury I was a little disappointed in this hotel. This was my first trip to Europe, so take that into consideration, but I found the hotel to be very small (but definitely clean) and lacking any extra. There wasn't even a clock in the room! The AC was minimal-could never get the room very cool and it would turn off when you left the room (someone told me later that I could have asked the front desk for another key-which keeps the AC running). So you can imagine when you are out all day in the sweltering heat and can't come home to a nice cool room. I know we are a bit wasteful and indulgent over here but AC is one luxury that is important to me. The European heat was really oppressive and we never felt we could get reprieve. Even in so called air conditioned stores (felt like a blow dryer). Anyways, besides that, the hotel was adequate and in a fairly good location. But has the bare minimum. The breakfast in the morning was not worth the 8 euros. There are many different little restaurants around that you can get something fairly decent to eat, that will probably cost you less. I probably wouldn't stay here again. But as I said, it does depend on what you are looking for. I think I like a little more of the conveniences.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay on a budget, in a good location”
Reviews.Author: montreality
Reviews.Content: I must say that I love Trip Advisor for helping me find this hotel! It is a gem if you're on a budget. The rooms are a bit on the small side but it wasn't a big deal at all. There was AC which was a plus since Barcelona was hot when we were there. The staff were courteous and helpful, and the room we stayed in was well-maintained and cleaned well. The location of the hotel is very central and close to a metro station. The area is a residential one which was a great thing for us because it has plenty of supermarkets, pharmacies and fruit stores. If there was a small downside, it would have been the lack of a mini fridge in the room that would have helped us save more money on breakfast, but it wasn't a big deal since there were quite a few hole in the wall "bars" that offered breakfast at a cheap price. All in all, this hotel left me with a positive impression and I would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: Wutan
Reviews.Content: Three night post cruise stay at Acta Antibes. Had 2 rooms for spouse and teenage kids. Rooms very clean with hardwood floors and offered free internet. Hotel is in residential area and 10 min walking distance to Sagrada Familia and Bus Turistic. Area very safe and there were some small grocery stores next to hotel for water and snacks. Location gave us an insight to where locals sleep, eat and shop. If you want luxury this is not the place for you. However if you want a great budget hotel in a great location, then this is it. Edward who works at reception was excellent. He is very organized and personable. Even though we arrived early ( 10 am) he checked us in , gave us maps, directions and alot of info especially about the pickpockets in La Ramblas. On our departure he ordered us a taxi to the airport and we had no problems being ripped off. Edward has a great future in the hotel industry.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, reasonably priced hotel”
Reviews.Author: kashpir_pl
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights at double room in September 2009 with an average rate of EUR 61 per night (without breakfast), what for Barcelona standards is very reasonable price for the standard we got. We did not have problems finding the hotel and we were welcomed by friendly staff. Room was cleverly designed, kept clean and generally nice. No objections to the bathroom. As for the location - probably there's no perfect place to stay in Barcelona as there are so many attractions :-) From Acta Antibes you can easily walk to Sagrada Familia and you also have a metro station few minutes away - for us it was good enough. Ask the staff about the good places for dining - we loved a tapas bar called Jaizkibel, specialising in seafood. There's also a good bar right across the street but I don't remember the name. We had no breakfast at the hotel, so in the mornings we visited a small bakery on the junction one street away for delicious bocadillos con jamon and energising cafe. If we come back to Barcelona we'll probably be staying here once again.

Reviews.Title: “Unexpected extra room makes pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: MrTeachCP
Reviews.Content: My wife and I traveled with our 26 year old daughter and booked a room for 3. We were pleasantly surprised to find two separate room with a queen bed in one and a single bed in the other. The rooms were fairly spacious with a nice closet. The single room did not have a TV, but they both had an air conditioner, although the one in the larger room didn't work very efficiently. The rooms were very quiet with noise from the street or the hallway. The bathroom was a nice size. There was no fan, but there was a louvered window which opened into a kind of well space. It was rather odd, and we realized that the neighbor room also had the same in their bathroom so if we were not careful they could see into our bathroom. It was definitely unique. The staff was friendly and available. The location was in a neighborhood a bit out of the center of town. It was near the have-to-visit Familia Sagrada, and you can easily walk to the town center or the beach. The subway is a few blocks away as well. There are a number of bar/cafe places to eat in the area, but many were smoking so hard to find a good place to eat.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, comfortable, clean and at the top of its rating.”
Reviews.Author: hbbgtravelers
Reviews.Content: Our extended family booked two rooms one for two and one for three. The hotel staff were very helpful and friendly. The rooms were clean, modern and spacious. The price is very reasonable. The hotel is only two blocks from the Monumental metro station, less then a ten minute walk to La Sagrada Familia and about a 20 minute walk or 5- 8 minute taxi ride to Placa Catalunya and La Rambla. The neighborhood is quiet and lovely with shopping and restaurants near.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gooner51
Reviews.Content: Stayed here one night whilst in transit thru Barcelona. Clean, neat rooms, with all the usual requirements, the location, 2 blocks from the metro, makes connections into and out of Placa de Catalunya (where the aerobus to the airport departs) simple. There are adequate bars and restaurants nearby. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: newmexone
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights at the Acta Antibes after a transatlantic cruise and we could not have been more pleased. The hotel is immaculate and the rooms large and comfortable although the beds were a bit hard especially for those used to pillow-top mattresses. Check-in was easy and luckily despite arriving at the hotel at around 10:30AM, we were able to get a room right away. The reception staff was very helpful. The hotel is in easy walking distance to La Sagrada Familia and had a number of good dining choices nearby. The only thing that I would like to have seen was more info about the fact that the breakfast was not included in the price of the room. We were very surprised to be met with a 8.50 Euro per person charge for breakfast. Had we known that, we would have dined elsewhere for much less. I accept some of the blame as I should have asked if there was a charge when I was told where and when breakfast was served.

Reviews.Title: “An Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: Trainlover1
Reviews.Content: I had originally booked 2 rooms online with this hotel for 3 days, as I was traveling with my wife, teenage son and sister-in-law. When we arrived, the person at the front desk checked my confirmation letter and asked if I would be interested in one room that would accomodate 4 people. The room was clean and spacious, were 2 beds in each of adjoining areas, giving full privacy. We accepted and the stay ending up costing us almost one-half of what we would have otherwise paid for the 2 separate rooms I had originally booked! Although it is located on a somewhat busy street, there are double windows which virtually eliminate all street noise. The hotel is a great value, being 2 blocks from the Metro stop and less than a 5 minute walk from the Sagrada Familia.

Reviews.Title: “Good price & location - fair price”
Reviews.Author: JoseMOliver
Reviews.Content: Staff very friendly. Excellent location... close to Sagrada Familia and metro station. Rooms very clean. Only one tip ask for a room in the end of the corridor. There are many rooms and we hearded sometimes heavy doors knocking....

Reviews.Title: “Very nice and clean budget hotel.”
Reviews.Author: tibimail
Reviews.Content: Just between 10 min walk to Sagrada Familia or 20 min walk to Plaza de Catalunya, is a good location but only if you're in good shape! Breakfast was OK also. This hotel was so clean and the room service was so good like in most 3 or 4 stars hotels. So I think I didn't see well: only 2 stars?

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: bryanac23
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very clean and simply appointed. Well located. Extremely helpful staff, went above and beyond to help us multiple times and spoke good english. Couldn't get a better hotel for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, grocery markets and metro close by”
Reviews.Author: kimberslovestotravel
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay here. They were very helpful to help give us directions to our church and a flea market. Researched the internet and showed us on the map. They were great. Rooms were simple yet clean. I appreciated how quiet the neighborhood was. Around the corner was a fantastic pizza\pasta place that was quite reasonable. Loved that the metro was so close. I'd stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: SunnyMorning
Reviews.Content: The hotel is simple, but clean. The biggest positive is the location - the metro is really nearby, Sagrada familia quite close, restaurants, shops, bank, pharmacy - you can find all in the same street. The staff was nice and helpful. The negatives - our room window was facing a wall and the is no minibar (i believe there is no restaurant in the hotel either). Both, the room and bathroom were small, but that's usual in big cities. Overall - it is a good chioce if you need a place to sleep and you will spend your days by discovering Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, Good Location, Decent Rooms, Poor Internet in Room”
Reviews.Author: Arrege
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my wife on a business trip to Spain - for 4 nights. We had read the reviews on Trip Advisor and chose to select this Hotel since we also got a good deal. I'll break down the details here; Cleanliness - Very clean, basic and simple hotel. It has a 'modernist' look - glass and metal - that makes the room and hotel look clean and polished. Rooms - The rooms are adequate in size for the price for Barcelona. We requested 2 separate beds since the 'double bed' would be too small. There is a small desk area and also a closet. No fridge though. The bathroom has a bidet as well. The curtains are completely dark and so you don't get any light if you close them - which is good for sleeping at night. Location: It is close to the metro (Monumental) - only about 200 yards away. It is also close to a couple of bakeries, a deli (fresh meat and cheeses), small supermarkets etc - so you can get fresh fruit, make your own sandwiches, get gallons of water etc - all for a decent price. Monumental station is also very central and can get you quickly to all major sights around the city. The city is also not too large so you can walk around and really get a good 'feel' of the city's 'energy'. Sleep Quality: We asked for a quiet room in the back of the Hotel. At night, there is practically no noise and light from the street. So you can sleep fairly well. The beds are average - nothing fancy - but well enough to get some sleep. Staff: The front desk was very helpful, intelligent and well informed. They spoke excellent English (as well as several other languages), were always available to help and accommodated our requests to check out a little later than the set time. Negative Points - Room Heating - When we were here, BCN was still cold (about 55 in the day and 37 at night). The room is supposed to have wall units w/ radiating heat - the kind that allow hot water to flow thru them and heat up the room. Problem is that they did not work well. No matter how you turned the heating knob, the heater would always feel 'warm'. We played around with it for an hour to test it out and we could not get it to work well. So it was a bit colder in the room that we would have liked. Internet/WIFI in the room - Since we were here on business, this was a big problem. The connection in our room was very poor. We could not get a connection. Our signal strength was very weak and emails could not be sent out. The only solution was to go down to the second floor - dining area - and get all work done here. Signal strength works best on the 2nd floor dining area. It is open 24 hours. Getting here from BCN Airport: If you're taking the metro to this Monumental stop from the Airport - and if you have larger bags - you're in for a rough time. The major interchange is at the 'Passeg di Gracia' station - and it's got a lot of stairs - up and down - and then also long walks thru crowds of people. So by the time you arrive at the Monumental station, you will be tired and irritated :)

Reviews.Title: “Good clean central hotel at affordable rates”
Reviews.Author: Manu73Paris
Reviews.Content: This is a good one, nice, clean, refurbished (the reception area), rooms are comfortable and the hotels location (10mins walk from Sagrada Familia, 20mins from La Rambla, Plaça Catalunya). Staff is very kind at reception, good english, helpful. I use this hotel for business trips only, so good, affordable place to sleep well.

Reviews.Title: “Nice clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: Brentivo
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great. We had great service, nice and clean room, and good value for money. We didnt get breakfast included, and when we asked about it, it seemed like it was worth avoiding anyway. The hotel staff let us put some milk in the fridge, and also helped us store our bags while we went to Andorra for some skiing :) It is walking distance from "Monumental", and there is a great, affordable internet cafe more or less across the road.

Reviews.Title: “A hotel that we would use again...”
Reviews.Author: navman
Reviews.Content: This hotel is midway between the centre of Barcelona and La Sagrada Familia. About 20 minutes walk, at the most, from either. Staff were friendly and the room was a good size and there was free wifi. We would certainly use it again if we returned

Reviews.Title: “We loved it”
Reviews.Author: DaldalandDondon
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at Acta Antibes. We were taking just two nights in the hotel before heading off to the Costa Brava coast. We recieved a good welcome from a reception desk that is staffed at all times. The main thing that struck us was the cleanliness and size of the rooms. It was a good location and handy for a couple of nights stay. It took us approx 30 mins to walk from Placa de Catalunya. The price was good and we definitely got value for money. We didn't stay for breakfast - it seemed costly for what was on offer. We were excited for getting out and about and there were too many lovely cafe's just around the corner.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel..... But”
Reviews.Author: oconjohn
Reviews.Content: Hi Just returned from a great trip to Barcelona and stayed at the Acta Antibes for 5 nights. The Hotel is situated close to the Metro Line called MONUMENTAL - this is very convenient for getting to and from most of the sights in Barcelona. The rooms are very clean and fresh towels supplied every day. The bed is not the greatest I've ever slept in - but overall I would rate it as good and very clean. There is some noise from Traffic on the street occasionally, and more importantly - the walls are quite thin and we could hear the neighbours talking. There is no BAR / LOUNGE facility. Staff speak very good English and are very friendly and helpful. We had one problem in that we checked out late ( my fault I admit ) - but we were charged an extra FULL Room rate - I fely they could have been a bit more generous having stayed for 5 nights. There are a number of Cafe's and Restaurants close by for Breakfast or a quick cup of coffee and prices are reasonable. There are also a few Supermarkets in the area. Taxi's can be had about two blocks away - cost to the Airport is about €30, and it takes about 35mins. That's it - overall - I would stay at the Acta Antibes again - it was a pleasant experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: ClydeUk
Reviews.Content: This hotel had a great location not only for getting around Barcelona but for getting to and from Girona airport. The hotel is barely a 5 mins walk from the station North bus station which you get the direct bus to and from Girona airport. For getting around Barcelona the metro station is around a 3 minute walk from the hotel. The hotel is is a very nice area and we would have no hesitation walking around day or night. There is also some restaurants and bars around the hotel. We would recommend he German place along the street towards the metro (litres of beer were too cheap and we got a lotle drunk!). If you fancy walking then you can walk to the Las Ramblas in about 40 minutes. Although it was a longer walk you can see a lot of nice things along the way and we always feel this is the best way to get to know a city. Staff were very nice in the hotel. They spoke a hugh variety of languages including excellent English and the main desk was manned 24 hours. We didn't take the breakfast but the lounge area it as served in looked very nice. The room consisted of two single beds, as you would expect in Spain; desk and chair;tv and an ensuit shower room. There was a highdryer in the bath room (cut down on luggage). We did have a large window but as the room faced inwards to other buildings no view. I think you would appreciate this is the summer as the room would stay cool. There was aircon in the room but we obviously (January) didn't need this. Hope this is all helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Clean modern hotel close to La Sagrada Familia”
Reviews.Author: eobri
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel in November 2009 and found it to be a great value. The hotel is located within walking distance of the Bus station (we arrived on Ryanair and the hotel is maybe 15 minutes walk north of the station) so was well located for our short trip to Barcelona. The Metro is in easy walking distance as well (maybe 5 minutes or so), which makes getting around the city a breeze. We also were able to walk to La Sagrada Familia on our first day there without much trouble -- well recommended. The hotel is relatively modern in style and located in a nice neighborhood. It is away from the "action" but still close enough to not be inconvenient for any of the sites of Barcelona. Since Barcelona is spread out anyway, no matter where you stay, you'll probably have to take public transport to get to some of the sites. On arrival, staff was friendly and immediately checked us in (it was early afternoon). Although we had booked a 'double' room, we were given a very large room, what I would call a suite with two separate sleeping areas. The room had hardwood floors and was extremely roomy and clean. The beds were a little hard and a little bit on the small side (bigger than the twins we had elsewhere). The bathroom was very clean as well. Overall, a great value for such a well located hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bripalm
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights at the hotel and had no complaints. Nothing fancy but served our needs well. Well located to get around the city on the metro, easy walk to Sagrada Familia and in a good area. Our room was clean and was a basic hotel room. Good value for the money. I would stay there again. We enjoyed the breakfast served at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Barcelonatrip with friends”
Reviews.Author: frkskanderup
Reviews.Content: An ok hotel located close to La Segrada de Familia. Nice clean rooms to an affordable price.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, nothing to write home about”
Reviews.Author: Worldbutterfly
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a good value in a great location. The rooms are very basic and small, but clean and pleasant. The price (51 euro/night) is excellent for a hotel just a five minute walk from Sagrada Familia church and close to two major Metro lines. If you're looking for a decent hotel close to the action (and don't plan to spend a lot of time in your room anyway), this is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “A hotel deserves more than 2 stars”
Reviews.Author: manchai
Reviews.Content: When I walked in the room, I was pleasantly surprised. Room was spacious (it wasn't something I expected for the price I paid) and comfortable (I like the wooden theme furniture). Hotel facilities were minimum but I didn't really need extra facilities, and I guess this helps to bring price down. Location was perfect - close enough to city centre and far enough to be quiet at night. My room was facing a cross-road and there was a bit of traffic noise, but with the windows closed this wasn't really noticable. It was actually quite interesting to look out the windows and see the world. There isn't a lot of eating places near the hotel but it is walking distance to city centre, so not a major problem. The neighbourhood of this hotel is actually quite nice. There was one minor problem - the radiator was too small for the size of the room - it was freezing at night. I asked for extra blanket and got it, so it wasn't a problem in the end. On that note, the staff were very polite. Overall it was a comfortable and enjoyable stay. I would be happy staying again, just hope the price won't go up though!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel and a great value”
Reviews.Author: davida23
Reviews.Content: We stayed here before and after a cruise and were very pleased. The rooms were spartan by American standards, but more than adequate. A very short walk to Sagrada Familia, restaurants, markets, and the subway. Just two short blocks from the Monumental station. As a budget hotel, we highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Good Budget Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sicilian0172
Reviews.Content: Room was okay, clean and spacious. but the aircon didn't work well. It was winter time, and the room was quite warm (room 417) so i have to open the window to get 'cool' breeze of air. Lots of cafe in surroundings and groceries that open till midnite, so just in case need to get mineral water etc. Price was very good, when i arrived at the hotel, they even give me a cheaper price compare to what i've booked in the internet. not to far with metro too, little bit walking is fun in travelling. So wouldn't hesitate to come back.

Reviews.Title: “Would recommend”
Reviews.Author: Pingoogirl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel after our visit in Paris. I would stay the travel from the airport to the hotel was much more comfortable for us here in Barcelona compared to the one we had in Paris. The hotel is very clean, newly renovated, conveniently located since it is close to the metro and a few minutes walk to Sagrada Familia. There are also a couple of restaurants close to the hotel. One thing to remember though is their metro's closes at 12 midnight. My husband and I had to walk all the way from La Rambla going back to the hotel which took us about 40 minutes. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel,would stay again”
Reviews.Author: nat152
Reviews.Content: Hotel location is brilliant and the price is excellent. rooms are basic but have all you need and are clean. its within walking distance to everywhere, I would definatly recommend this hotel and will be staying again next time I go to Barcelona

Reviews.Title: “Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: lashmac
Reviews.Content: unreal value for money!! hotel is walking distance to everything, the only time we used a taxi was to get from the main bus station to the hotel(which is only 3 blocks away)!!! we walked the next time we needed to go to the bus station!! check in was super quick, got a room on the 6th floor, they have an elevator!! room was spotless, nice bed, need some extra pillows thou! safe in weardrobe and worked well. tv on the other hand was crap, had one english chanel and it was bbc news. bathroom was all that you need, toilet, shower/small bath, sink and most important a hair dryer that worked fairly well! they have an air conditioner in the room also! breakie was not included but there is a supermarket a few doors down and we just got a few bits there that did us for our stay! if you are lookin for a cheap and cheerful place to stay then i would highly recommend this hotel!! booking.com gave me the best price!

Reviews.Title: “Everything you want from a city hotel”
Reviews.Author: MrKiez
Reviews.Content: The hotel is good. Clean room, enough space in the room, daily cleaning. The breakfast is not included and isn't really super (eg no fresh fruit) Other than that we found that the hotel was everthing it promised to be.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value & Nice Room”
Reviews.Author: lazy_kitty
Reviews.Content: One sentence: Great Value for excellent room and good service from the staff. The staff even help us to book the Flamenco dance which is only 27Euro (5Euro cheaper than market price). Allow us to leave our luggage with no extra charge and free internet (abit slow but alright for check mails). Nice pretty room with build in wardrobe, flat screen t.v, air-condition for the hot summer, bath tub, good bed, towel & bed sheets change everyday and spacious room. Just 3stops from the centre and the hotel just few steps from the metro station. We even walk to Sagrada Familia, just 5-10minutes. Try the set lunch at Lucano Restaurant few shops away from the hotel, good food.

Reviews.Title: “It was fine”
Reviews.Author: lizegg
Reviews.Content: The hotel is nicely located near the Monumental station, and a quick walk to Sagrada Familia. There is a delicious restaurant a few doors down (toward the metro) called Restaurante Nogales. (?) The lunch special is delicious and well-priced, and the staff was excellent. The hotel staff was helpful for all the questions we had. We booked the hotel in advance, and paid in advance, but when we left, the staff insisted we hadn't paid yet and ran my credit card through. I tried to argue, but since I had a cab waiting and charging me to wait, I gave them the card. When I got home, I realized I had been double charged, but they had credited my account the second charge. This was the only frustrating experience with the hotel. They should know better. The rooms are fine. The television is about 3 inches, and the tub is about the same size. There are strange vents that when open, look into your neighbor's shower--awkward. There is wifi, you have to ask for a code to use it. Also, the mattress pads are lined in plastic, which make for an uncomfortable sleeping experience. I'd probably stay somewhere new in Barcelona before going here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very good place”
Reviews.Author: Homyak
Reviews.Content: I definetly recommend it as the hotel is located very conveniently and the rooms are nice. best value for money!

Reviews.Title: “Good Location with Clean Rooms”
Reviews.Author: mrsghaz
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel was great - just two blocks away from Monumental station & maybe a 5-10min stroll to Sagrada Familia. We didn't have the breakfast in the hotel as there were many shops along the way where we can buy nice food. The room was small but it didn't matter as we were out most of the time. Most importantly, everytime we came back, it was spotless - very clean with new towels & soap.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: GlobeTrotter351
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel to stay in to explore Barcelona if your budget is about 90 Euro/night. The hotel is on the same block as a supermarket, ATM, restaurants and 2 blocks from the Monumental Metro. Taxis are also available too. The rooms are basic but clean. The staff is not very friendly or helpful but you won't need them if you have a good guidebook. Also, don't get the 10 Euro breakfast if not included in your rate, there are several other options in the area for less than that.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Place”
Reviews.Author: Energgg
Reviews.Content: Hotel prices in Barcelona can get pricey...This hotel is basic for a tourists needs, as you will be out of it most the time anyway- The lobby is really nice\trendy- The room is very small for USA standards- The bed is really hard especially after a day of exploring the city- The location is fairly good, close to food, restaurants, supermarkets, subway, & sites- Staff is helpful but not very personable- It has a safe in the room (but I suggest counting your money before locking it in) It is quiet at night (even after Barcelona soccer team won cup and rest of city was rioting, did not get woken up) The room has individual A\C & works great as the city can get hot- Good hotel if looking for just basic accommodations-

Reviews.Title: “Basic accomodation in good location for good value”
Reviews.Author: Sportacus99
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights for the F1 GP. The room was small but clean and overall the service was excellent. The location is perfect being near the Monumental metro station and of within walking distance of the Sagrada Familia. Would recommend for a short city break.

Reviews.Title: “Goodvalue, nice people.”
Reviews.Author: Geordylad
Reviews.Content: We had a three day break in Barcelona and chose the Acta Antibes from the TripAdvisor reviews. It's clean, value for money, neat and simple but the best part of the deal is the staff - polite,professional, helpful and friendly. Good location - walk the five minutes to the Sagrada Familia after dark to see the spectacular floodflighting. Catch the Metro at Monumental - another five minutes, to get any where in the city. Buses are as close as the Metro but we walked to most of the tourist sites - Las Ramblas, the parks, the Monderisme buildings (not just the Gaudis), the Bario Gotic. Suggestions - go to the Fundacio Joan Miro as soon as they open in the morning (it gets hectic later on), Metro from Monumental to Paral-lel, don't leave the station to change to the funicular up the hill, its all in the one fare. Then walk on up the hill to catch a whole range of views across town. Eat at the Nogal restaurant a couple of doors down from the Acta Antibes. It's packed with local people eating, drinking, celebrating birthdays. Lunch - three good courses, water and a bottle of wine, 18 euros for two. More good restaurants along Disputacio. Buy a T-10 travel ticket. Avoid the Passeig Gracia Metro station if you can - it's confusing and full of long tunnels. (And we found a family of wild rabbits in an empty site just a block from the hotel on one of the busiest roads in Barcelona.)

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased”
Reviews.Author: Canadian1951
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this small hotel both before and after taking a Mediterranean cruise from Barcelona, and based the booking decision after reading about it in Trip Advisor reviews. We were very satisfied, and hotel accurately described. Initially we were in a larger room with three single beds, and upon our return we were in a double bed room. As noted previously, it is not luxurious, but room and bath very clean and safe. We walked everywhere easily in the core areas, and enjoyed the open top tourist bus...really need the two day pass for the tour bus as there is so much to see. You get a discount package for tour from the hotel. Staff were friendly and helpful, grocery store, internet cafe, and ATMs nearby. Small walk to metro or bus, but Barcelona is easy to navigate on foot. For those wanting a reasonably priced clean place to sleep, and within walking distance of major places, including Sagrada Famillia and La Rambla, we would certainly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, cleanliness, free breakfast, and room, but lousy bed”
Reviews.Author: grlantrn13
Reviews.Content: My wife and I visited Barcelona and have stayed here for 6 nights. You really can't beat this location. It's in a quiet neighborhood that has a few cafe's and bars (nothing amazing, but decent). The photos on this site are actually quite accurate. It's a pretty little hotel. I'll make a list of the pro's and the few con's Pro's: 1.5 blocks from Metro 26 euro cab ride from airport Less than a 30 minute safe walk to most attractions (Passeig de Gracia-our favorite, Sagrada Familia-the Gaudi cathedral, Las Ramblas, The Gothic Quarter) Great value (it averaged 100 euro per night) Helpful staff who speaks english (we were happy to try our spanish, though) Free breakfast including a selection of meats and cheeses, yogurt, fruit salad, breads, cereals, cappucino, espresso, tea, and juices. Saves you 10-20 euro on breakfast/coffee daily. our room faced the street, but there were double sliding windows, so the noise was not a problem. Free wireless internet Con's The bed was like a rock. My back is killing me The air conditioner didn't work very well, we'd often wake up sweating only to find that it had stopped pumping cool air for some unknown reason (fortunately, the weather is great, so we just opened the window, but then there would be some noise). If you stay here, make sure to walk down to the Passeig de Gracia to see the Gaudi buildings and eat at Cervecceria Catalana (C/ Mallorca 236). It was easily the best restaurant we ate at. Amazing tapas. Also, El Xampanyet in the Gothic Quarter (next to the Picasso museum) was a must.

Reviews.Title: “Valentines in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: robinelisse
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay at this hotel from the reviews on TripAdvisor and the price. Arriving at the Main Bus Station it was a quick walk to the Hotel. Very convenient. The staff were polite, spoke English, and were helpful with some touristy suggestions. The room was comfortable, clean, and European small. Close walking tourist spots are the Sagrada Familia Church, and the Bullfighting Arena. Besides that we took the Metro from the stops by either the Sagrada Church or the Bullfighting arena to La Rambla. You can buy Tourist Metro Cards which are good for 2 or 3 days. Economic price. You can walk to La Rambla, we did, and we walked by the Arc de Triomf, and past the Park. I would recommend this hotel for those who would like an afforable hotel within Barcelona that is comfortable, safe, clean, and close to some main tourist attractions. My husband and I were here for our Valentines, and we really enjoyed Barcelona. From a Fat Tire Bike Tour, Watching a Barca Football Match (soccer), Visually enjoying Sagrada Familia, Walking through Parc Guell, Strolling along La Ramblas, Having a moment to relax in the Cathedrals' tranquil garden, and Having a Picnic on the Beach. A wonderful place!

Reviews.Title: “Great value hotel - 2*+++++++”
Reviews.Author: Hola1888
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2 nights in February with my husband. The price along with the proximity to the Nord Bus Station (we arrived at Girona Airport via Ryanair and caught the bus to Nord Station - approx 6 min walk to hotel from station) and the good reviews made this hotel attractive to us. We only paid 50 euros per night which I thought to be very reasonable for a City hotel. The hotel rooms were spotless, the hotel staff very courteous and the location exactly as described. We didn't bother with breakfast (as suggested by previous reviewers) - we ate locally for 1.90 euro (croissant/baguette with coffee/tea) with plenty of restaurants/cafes to choose from. There's a supermarket virtually next door which we used to stock up on water, juice, fruit etc We didn't use any public transport while we were in the City - we choose to walk everywhere! It took us approximately 15 mins to walk to the Place de La Catalunya / Passeig de Gracia, approximately 10 mins to walk to the Parc de Cituadella and only around 6 minutes to the Sagrada Familia. (Although if we had stayed longer we would have ventured further and also taken the Open Top Bus Tour.) Overall, I would strongly recommend this hotel if you don't mind staying a bit further away from Las Ramblas.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent find”
Reviews.Author: Paddywaggon
Reviews.Content: This really is a great find amount the hotels in Barcelona. Whilst small it is handy to most attractions and the hotel staff are excellent nothing is too much for them to help with. Some building work on reception area at this time so entrance is via the garage. Hotel 10 minutes walk from main street and plenty of small local restaurants on the walk.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Citytraveller2
Reviews.Content: The TA reports on this hotel are generally spot-on. This is a 2 star hotel and only cost me £61 GBP a night for bed & breakfast through Hotelopia – very good for a city hotel. Some companies wanted 80 GBP for just the room! The shops are open until 10pm, so I only used the room to sleep & shower. My room, like many on the pictures, had a wooden floor and wooden headrest and was very clean. I asked for a quiet room and got one at the far end of the corridor on the 4th floor. Although this overlooked the street, it had double glazing with a gap of about 30cm, so I could hardly hear anything. The windows opened if you wanted fresh air and the air con worked well. It was very dark with the curtains closed. The ensuite was fine, although there was only a half-length hip bath (see pictures). The staff all spoke English and were helpful – they stored my suitcase on the last day as I had a late flight. One of them showed me other rooms (I have friends coming later in the year) and it is possible to have rooms with up to 4 beds in. He told me all rooms now have a free digital safe – handy in a city! Despite the website, he tells me there is no bar, although there are loads of bars and restaurants locally. I had breakfast within my price but most pay separately - €8. It was a very basic – ham, cheese, rolls, bread, cereal, coffee and I don’t think it was worth it. Directions. I took the Metro to the hotel as it cost less than €1 compared with about €20 for a taxi. From El Prat airport, cross the over-road bridge, between terminals A & B. At the end is the ticket office for the RENFE trains. If you buy a T10 ticket for €7.20, this lasts for 10 journeys. Change at Passeig de Gracia and walk through lots of corridors & stairs following the signs for the purple line 2 – direction Pep Ventura. Travel 2 stops and exit at Monumental. At the ticket barrier take the left hand exit to the road (away from Placa de Torros) and at street level turn 180 degrees. Take the next road on the right (a few yards), which is Carrer de la Diputacio. The hotel is a short way on the left – look out for number 394.

Reviews.Title: “Should be more than 2 stars...”
Reviews.Author: alisonharris123
Reviews.Content: This was my first visit to Barcelona, I stayed at Antibes hotel for 4 nights and I was really impressed with the quality and value for money. Located near the 'sagrada familia' and 2 minutes from a metro station, it is in an ideal spot for exploring the city. It was cleaned every day, staff were friendly,our room was spacious and we even had a bath, not bad for 75 euros a night! Overall, excellent value, I'd stay there again :)

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: TheHitman69
Reviews.Content: I booked two triple rooms for a group of six lads visiting Barcelona to watch FC Barcelona play. Some properties do not welcome large groups of males however the Antibes had no problem with this and were extreamly helpful at all times. I have to point out that we are not a group of trouble makers but many hotels see an enquiry from 6 English men and run a mile. The hotel is in a quieter area of town but you are 5-10 minutes walk from several bars and restaurants including a tapas bar across the road which I can recommend. Also within 5-10 minutes walk is a bull ring, metro, bus stops ond La Sagrada Familia. The Av. Diagonal is just around the corner too which cut right trough the city. The rooms are very spacious and clean and on each floor there is a a breakfast area which at other times of the day can serve as a meeting up point as there is a vending machine here.

Reviews.Title: “Average Antibes”
Reviews.Author: daisymoo
Reviews.Content: We booked a room with Antibes through Venere, and stayed there for 2 nights during our recent visit to Barcelona. The hotel is located in a relatively quiet residential area (Eixample), and is within 2 blocks (5 min walk) from the nearest metro station (Monumental). It takes <10min (bus No. 62 or metro) when making your way down to the main square (Placa Catalunya). All in all, the hotel met, but did not exceed, our expectations. You won't encounter any language barriers (all their staff manning the reception desk speak English), but do note that your hotel room might look somewhat older than the one featured in the TA 'Hotel Photos' section.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel with super location”
Reviews.Author: Persim
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights at this hotel and enjoyed it very much. The room was small but clean and quiet. The location is fantastic, just off the Gran Via and within easy walking distance to Sagrada Familia, the bullfighting ring, and Las Ramblas. It is 2 minutes to the metro stop to get eveywhere else.
