The staff was very helpful (although we didn't think much of their eating recommendations). Breakfast was basic and we would probably skip it if staying again.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice would return”
Reviews.Author: familydownumder
Reviews.Content: Great location easy safe walk to a metro. Cafes near by. Friendly very helpfull staff. Family room was basic but very clean and comfortable. It was quite and dark when we closed the shutters. Perfect after a long flight. I would return and feel this hotel is very good value for money

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced for what you get”
Reviews.Author: houndtang
Reviews.Content: Whilst aware that Barcelona is an expensive city for accomodation, I do feel that Hotel Antibes was not great value for money. The room was clean, but quite basic, with no bath, safe or toiletries other than soap and a shampoo sachet. There was also a strange orange light above the door which could not be turned off and had to be left on all night. Breakfast was similarly basic - juice, croissant, prepackaged toast and a roll. The location was reasonable but about a 25 minute journey via metro to La Rambla. I stayed in a hotel in Madrid for the same price which was very central and of a higher quality so was a bit disappointed by the Antibes. Not awful, but not worth 110 Euros per night.

Reviews.Title: “Antibes good value for money”
Reviews.Author: MikkoTurku
Reviews.Content: Hotel Antibes is a good value-for-money hotel with good location in a lively but safe neighbourhood. Particularly good for a family with small children is the location close to an accessible metro station (Monument). A few blocks further is a tram station where you can get to the beaches. The staff was very friendly and the receptionists were proficient in English (plus other languages) and helped us with various information and with delayed baggage. There were a couple of good restaurants (les Nenes, Nogal) on the block and a couple of supermarkets nearby. Room was clean, good size and the air conditioning worked well.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value and definately more than 2 stars!”
Reviews.Author: uk1raver
Reviews.Content: We booked three rooms - 1 quad, 1 triple and 1 double. All rooms has consistent furnishings with flat screen tvs, air conditioning and spacious cupboards. The hotel is only 5 mins walk (4 blocks) from the Nord Bus Station and 5 mins walk from Monumentum metro stop which is very convenient for travelling into the centre. The Ramblas is about 20mins walk or 2 metro stops ways which was very ideal. The reception staff were VERY friendly and were always happy to assist. I would highly reccomend this hotel if you're looking for something centrally located but on a budget too.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: thinkstr8
Reviews.Content: Our family of four stayed in this hotel's two bedroom suite for a few nights. We got a great deal on this room...much better than getting two separate rooms almost anywhere else in this expensive city. At first, we were a bit skeptical because of the two star category and because the external appearance of the building is kind of old (we usually prefer 3-4 star hotels, but availability was very limited throughout the city this particular weekend). However, when we saw how renovated the interior was, we immediately lost all worries. The renovated rooms like they could belong in a 4 star hotel. Our room had a small foyer with closet that connected to each bedroom and the bathroom. Everything was adequate in terms of size and space. They have an underground car park, helpful reception desk, and the hotel was easy to find and drive to. As other reviews have stated, the metro is close by as are several stores and the famous Sagrada Familia. I would estimate that it was close to a 10 minute walk to this church, but it was just a few blocks down and I hardly noticed the time pass. The neighborhood is fine and I felt safe walking alone at night. The one reason why we didnt give this experience 5 stars is because the air conditioner in the hotel was being repaired during our stay. Although it wasnt too hot at this time, it wasnt exactly cool and breezy either. This made sleeping a bit uncomfortable, but I know there was nothing the hotel could do about this. They were trying to repair the a/c in time for the really hot months. So, if you are booking for this summer, make sure you ask them about the a/c!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place”
Reviews.Author: WF_couple
Reviews.Content: Rooms were nice and clean. Front desk staff were helpful. Good location...the subway is two blocks away; bus station is several blocks away but still walkable. Grocery store is right next door.

HotelInfo.Name: Acta Antibes
HotelInfo.Address: C/ Diputacio, 394, 08013 Barcelona, Spain
